runs.comm: and nearly the fourth duck... This is a peach. Lenght ball, outside off, seams in alarmingly, and cuts him in two. Lucky to not edge it. Gets a bye

short and wide, and this time - unlike the other night - a Pakistan batsman doesn't oblige KUla by hitting it straight to Dilshan at point. Shehzad hits it straight of the backward point, and gets four for it
short of a length, closer to the stumps, defended off the back foot
length ball outside off, winging in, pushed wide of mid-off for one
short of a length, outside off, holding its line, left alone
huge inswinger, Hafeez looks to turn this to leg, is beaten, but the ball is headed down leg
length ball outside off, swings away, left alone
slightly short, and he gets on top of it, and cuts it to third man for one
Hafeez still edgy. Pushes tentatively at a length ball, gets an inside edge onto the pad. The ball has gone nowhere but he wants a single. Rightly sent back
short of a length, outside off, punched to straight cover - five balls, no run for Hafeez
wildish. Shimmies down slightly, makes a bit of room, looks to go over extra, but is beaten by the swing
Hafeez off the mark finally. Outswinger, on a length, wide, and he has driven this along the ground, through cover

Shehzad is gone. Dead plumb. Inswinger from Kula, on a length, and Shehzad is caught on the back foot and beaten. Hit right in front. When Kula gets the inswingers right and accurate, he is a tough customer
defends a shortish delivery outside off
another big inswinger, headed towards top of off, defended off the front foot
this one holds its line outside off, pushed to cover
inswinger now, and Latif is right forward to defend it back. Are we headed towards a wicket-maiden?
the outswinger now. Good over from Kula. Alternating inswingers and straighter deliveries. This one not only holds its line, it leaves Latif a little. Latif drives, but is beaten. Wicket-maiden
short of a length, on off, pushed to cover
length ball, on off, defended back to Mathews
short of a length, holds its line outside off, played with an open face, to point
tenth dot in a row. Short of a length, just outside off, Hafeez is not adventurous, and defends this to point
Now kicks in the adventure. Hafeez comes down the track, and even though this is not on a driving length, he lofts it over extra cover
and has he dropped one? Hafeez drives at an outsiwnger, and it passes very close to the bat. Sanga fails to make a clean collection, and it doesn't matter if Hafeez edged it or no
this ball stops at him a little as Latif checks the shot, and hits it uppishly past the bowler for one
slower ball, another check shot, but this time along the ground, and straight to cover
another ball that stops at him. It grips too. A bit of a legcutter, and it hits the sticker of a defensive bat
absolute heave-ho this time, but the bat and ball are in different zip/pin codes. Again the ball stops and bounces
straighter this time, clipped away off the pad, gets a couple to deep midwicket

Hafeez has hit a straight drive to claim the wicket of Latif! Crisply hit back at Perera. This is going for four. But Perera gets a touch to it, and the ball hits the stumps. Latif is backing up, and hasn't had time to get back. They don't even call for the replays. The finger goes up, Latif goes out
length ball outside off, defended back to him
angled sharply away, left alone outside off
short of a length, on off, punched to mid-off
nice seam movement away from Akmal, and beats his drive outside off. No slower balls so far from Udana
drives this outside off, with a slightly open face, can't beat point
short and wide, cut straight to cover-point. Second maiden in the Powerplay. Twenty-nine dot balls. You'd think they are playing on a fifth day pitch in a parched land
length ball on the pads, flicked away nicely, wide of deep midwicket
length ball, outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, pushed back to him
short of a length, not much room, dabbed down to third man for one
length ball, on off, Akmal moves across, defends to cover
short of a length, on the stumps, pushed to mid-on for a quick single
length ball, on the pads, pushed wide of mid-on for one
short and wide, late-cuts it, square of thid man, gets a couple
full, swinging in a touch, beats the drive, but concedes a leg-bye
low full toss on the pads, helped away for a couple into the leg side
short of a length, on the pads, worked away for one
short of a length, not much room, cut straight to point

and he strikes first ball. Akmal premeditates a paddle, Kaushal bowls a flat legbreak, and he misses. My first reaction says Akmal is unlucky, but I am still waiting for replays. I am wrong. This is a good decision. Length ball, pi6ches outside off, doesn't turn, goes with the angle, hits him in front of off. The lack of turn did him in
short of a length, punched away for an easy single
flat legbreak, Hafeez waits for it, and then back-cuts it past point. A welcome boundary indeed
flat, on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
straying onto the pads, pushed straight to midwicket
short of a length, straight, Malik stays back and defends
short of a length, on off, pushed back to the bowler
dabbed to third man for a single
length ball, no room, on the front foot, defends to cover-point
dropped by Perera. Ugly swipe from Hafeez, gets a thick top edge towards Perera, who runs in from third man, reaches the ball, but can't hold it low
short now, and pulled away to deep midwicket
short, on off, pulled away to deep midwicket
pushed down the leg side, wide
Kaushal gets another. Soft dismissal. Short, on the pads, stays a touch low, hurries onto him, and he has hit it straight to shortish midwicket
full on the pads, no turn, beaten, hit on the pad outside leg
full ball, he gets across and paddles it fine of fine leg for two
huge shout for lbw. Pretty similar to Akmal. Length ball, on off, beats the paddle sweep, hit right in front, but the umpire reckons it has hit the glove. Can't tell from the replays
pushed off the back foot, past point for one
short, outside off, punched to long-off for one
full toss, on off, driven down to long-on for one
flighted outside off, driven wide of long-on for two
short of a length, holds its line outside off, pushed wide of cover
shot of the day so far. Pitched up outside off, and even though he is going against the turn, he clears extra cover with ease
flatter quicker delivery as expected, Afridi stays back to defend. No room there
turning into the pads, looks to work it around the corner, can't beat short fine leg
flighted around off, not turn, Malik defends to cover
flatter, into the pads, pushed to short midwicket
again no turn, no room either, and Malik defends it back to him
short and wide, cut away to deep point
Afridi makes room, he follows, and Afridi manages to lob this over his head for a couple
short of a length, punched wide of sweeper-cover
short of a length, not much room, played with an open face, gets a single
fired in, worked past midwicket for one
flighted outside off, pushed wide of cover-point
lovely shot from Afridi. Always good to watch someone go over extra cover. Afridi makes room early, Senanayake bowls full and just outside off, Afridi lofts over cover. Inches short of being a six
quick, into the pads, worked away for one
full, on off, driven to long-on
nice shot. Malik shimmies down the track, not too close to the pitch of the ball, has some room to swing through, and lofts it straight. At long-on, Thirimanne drives straight over it
Malik pulls out the extra-cover drive this time. Beautiful shot. Comes down the track, and goes inside-out, along the ground too
He is expecting the shorter, flatter delivery, and sure enough he gets it. Malik pulls this over midwicket for the third straight boundary. How badly Pakistan needed this
fired in again, punched along the ground to deep midwicket
short of a length, flicked away powerfully to deep midwicket
full on the pads, worked away for a single - at 15 runs, the best over for Pakistan so far
short delivery, he cuts it, but can't beat point
a good yorker, dug out for one. That's good. Not sure why many bowlers don't bowl the yorker
overpitched, driven down the ground, not timed sweetly, which actually allows them the time to take the second
slower ball, short and wide, guided to third man for one
slower ball again, not much room, but he manages to cut it to deep point for one
low full toss, driven to long-on just for one
full and wide, driven over point, gets a couple to square of third man
full, just outside off, Afridi moves across and violently whips it away for four through midwicket
Afridi sees the plan, and beats it. Makes room, a lot of room, and takes this full delivery from well outside leg, and goes inside-out over cover
bouncer with third man and fine leg in the circle, Afridi tries the upper cut and misses. What a grunt he lets out. Sanga isn't impressed with the bowler either
sharp delivery, short of a length, into the pads, no room, and he gets a leg-bye
Malik moves across, Perera follows him, gets decent bounce too, and all Malik manages is a push to point
goes for a big hit down the ground, doesn't hit it well, which is just as well because this doesn't carry to long-on
slower ball, too full, but Malik has lost all timing because of the change of pace, and gets a single to long-on

that's eight runs in the credit for the stumps at the non-striker's end. At least this time no wicket falls. Afridi absolutely smashes this half-volley into the stumps. Kula doesn't even want to get a hand to it
whipped to deep midwicket for one. No room again
slower ball outside off, doesn't bounce at all, beats his attempt to cut it
big wide down the leg side as this slower one goes wrong
another slower one, legcutter, outside off, and Malik is beaten again. Bounces well short of Sanga. Top over from Kula
slower legcutter, for a moment it seems to have done Afridi in, but he stands back, and just powers it over the bowler's hand. Off the back foot
Dilshan has dropped a sitter. Would you drop it? Long hop from Perera, Afridi toe-ends a pull, but Dilshan lets it slip through at deep midwicket

Dilshan takes this one, but is still cross with himself for having dropped the previous one. Short again, but stays a little low. Malik pulls, and finds Dilshan to perfection. Dilshan throws the ball away in disgust, and doesn't even join the others in celebrating. Clearly disappointed with the previous delivery
pushed towards long-off for a single. Over to Lala
full, on the stumps, and the first six of the match. Lala goes boom. Clears the front leg, gets under this, and goes straight over the bowler's head. One short of a fifty in his 50th game
Arafat punches this to sweeper-cover, and gives the strike to Afridi
nice yorker, middle and leg, dug out to long-off for one. Reaches the fifty. Muted celebrations. Afridi is not thrilled. Team still in the woods
bouncer, Arafat comes down the track, and cuts it in the air, straight to Dilshan at sweeper-cover. Dilshan still not emoting much. Arafat has at least brought Afridi back on strike
full toss down leg, Afridi premeditates a paddle, misses, but this is not called a wide. Umpire reckons it brushed the pad
full toss, drilled down the ground, between long-on and long-off, Perera saves it with his foot

another paddle missed, once again not called a wide. That's because this ball has hit the leg stump without dislodging the bail. Kulasekara fiddles with the stumps, wondering why it wouldn't let go off the bail. Afridi is disappointed at missing out on two deliveries on the pads
